editorialSummary.text: Low-impact toning using the ballet barre offered in a modern studio with lockers & apparel for sale.

originalText.text:
Loving everything about Upper East Side Pure Barre for more than 5 years! The teachers are inspirational-the classes are so well crafted and then taught with high energy and motivation, cued with precision.  At the start of every class the Teacher learns each students name   along with  their pertinent injury/limitation  history. Throughout the class they then offer students  modifications to accommodate any of those limitations.  From the first moment of class the teachers give supportive call outs (yes by name) to
Keep you motivated and going strong!!
In terms of results Pure Barre gets you toned, long and strong!  So yes Iâ€™m addicted (and I give thanks to my daughter who gifted me my first class). I LOVE IT !!  (Iâ€™m over 750 classes in)

originalText.text: Pure Bar is the best workout Iâ€™ve found for total body. I saw results within 2 weeks after taking 3-4 classes a week. I lost weight, lost inches, built muscle and have a ton of energy. The Instructors are hands on and motivating, staff is warm and welcoming. Classes are hard, but itâ€™s over in a snap and it feels so good! Highly recommend for all levels.

text.text: Pure Bar is the best workout Iâ€™ve found for total body. I saw results within 2 weeks after taking 3-4 classes a week. I lost weight, lost inches, built muscle and have a ton of energy. The Instructors are hands on and motivating, staff is warm and welcoming. Classes are hard, but itâ€™s over in a snap and it feels so good! Highly recommend for all levels.

originalText.text:
I started exploring barre workouts last year after a friend and I did one together.  I moved recently and started looking around for studios to try and saw Pure Barre offered their Foundations class for free for newcomers.  I enjoyed the format, the energy from the instructor (Alice) and her openness in helping me learn the terminology and their associated movements (tuck!).  I decided to sign up for a 4 credit monthly membership, which allows you to sign up for a class once a week, which is perfect for me!

One of my favourite things about PB is that once you're in the studio and the class has started, you forget about everything else outside of that room - instead, you are completely focused on improving your form, losing your mind in the physical challenge as you build strength and balance.  My posture has improved and I incorporate the stretches and warmups in my other workouts when I'm not at the studio.  All of the instructors I've had so far at this studio are also so eager to help you achieve your goals, whether it's learning the terms, perfecting your form, or altering the exercise to customize the challenge for you so that you can enjoy PB fully.

I'm still very new to PB, having only taken 6 classes, but it's been a great form of exercise and something that I actually look forward to doing.  Highly recommend you coming in to just try the Foundations class... who knows, you might like it! ðŸ˜Š

originalText.text: Absolutely love this studio! Every instructor is so attentive and friendly. They make the effort to get to know your name and always make you feel comfortable. I have been taking pure barre classes for years and this studio has become my consistent studio for the last 2 years.

originalText.text: Iâ€™ve been going to this location for more than 3 years now, and will miss everyone so much now that Iâ€™m moving away! All the teachers are really talented, always giving each of us one-on-one hands on attention, and working with us to help us meet our fitness goals. Thank you guys for everything!! Miss you already!
